title: Great British Bake Off fan fave Henry Bird eliminated in quarter final
text:
Henry has become the latest star to exit the Bake Off (Picture: Channel 4)

The Great British Bake Off has dealt a scandalous blow to rival Dev and Dianne’s Strictly exit – with fan favourite Henry eliminated from the competition.

The 20-year-old Durham student was given his marching orders after a disastrous pastry week which was filmed in the midst of the summer heatwave this year.

Throw in the fact the gang have to work over an oven and things quickly got complicated for the group.

While initially impressing with this signature challenge – where he created a crab, tomato and new potato tarte tatin topped with crab salad – his technical challenge saw things begin to go wrong.

Challenged with creating a Moroccan pie alongside remaining competitors Alice, Steph, David and Rosie, he left the judges unimpressed as it collapsed under its own weight.

His fate was sealed in a tricky showstopper challenge, where Paul Hollywood branded the sweet and savoury pies he presented ‘bone dry’.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Prue also took him to task for his ‘maddening’ soggy pastry.

Now his time on the show is over, he hopes to become a journalist after completing his degree at Durham university.

‘I have two more years left at Durham University studying English,’ he said. ‘And having interned and written with various publications over the summer, the world of journalism and media is one that really speaks to me.’

David, Rosie, Alice and Steph are this year’s semi-finalists (Picture: Channel 4)

‘I am still baking at uni, and thankfully me and my four housemates managed to bag a flat in Durham with a lovely kitchen that overlooks the river and, crucially, has a dishwasher,’ he added.

‘I absolutely love my course, and still sing in the college choirs, but I’ve made sure to set aside a time on the weekends to get a bit of baking in.’

Hope to see you (and your baking) in the newsroom soon, Henry!

More: The Great British Bake Off Great British Bake Off’s David sparks huge debate over lidless pies Henry and Alice from GBBO: Who are the bakers surrounded by Bake Off romance rumours? Where is The Great British Bake off filmed and does it change location?

On the plus side, the semi-finals are now in our sights, with remaining hopefuls, Steph, Alice, David and Rosie still competing.

Steph seems to be the far running fave to take home the sought-after cake stand win, after winning star baker for a fourth week.

The Great British Bake Off continues Tuesday at 8pm on Channel 4.

description: Durham University student Henry, 20, was a fan favourite thanks to his shirt-and-tie combos but missed the mark on pastry week.
